thread.title: Search continues today for missing Barrie senior Mandy Thompson
thread.title_full: Search continues today for missing Barrie senior Mandy Thompson | CTV Barrie News

author: CTV Barrie
title: Search continues today for missing Barrie senior Mandy Thompson
text:
Police are continuing their search today for a missing Barrie senior, who was last seen almost a month ago.
Thirty officers with the OPP and Barrie police are re-examining areas east of Penetanguishene Road into Oro-Medonte for Mandy Thompson. This is where a surveillance camera last caught a glimpse of the 72-year-old on Feb. 3.
Police originally called off the search on Feb. 10, but investigators are hoping to take advantage of the warm weather. Officers are looking for any clues that may have been covered up by the snow.
Investigators are using an OPP helicopter, a canine unit and a drone to aid in the search.
Thompson was reported missing on Feb. 3 after she went missing from her home on Laidlaw Drive in Barrie.
Police say they havenâ€™t received any new tips and hope that anyone with information will contact them or Crime Stoppers.
Related Stories New photo of missing senior Mandy Thompson released Police call off search for missing senior Mandy Thompson Photos Barrie police released this new image of Mandy Thompson on Friday, Feb. 17, 2017. 
Mandy Thompson can be seen in these undated photos provided by Barrie Police Service.
